name: Mysteries at the Museum
overview: Don Wildman unearths relics from the world's greatest institutions to reveal secrets from the past. He examines each artifact to illuminate history's most incredible triumphs, sensational crimes and bizarre encounters.

episodes.name: Alcatraz, Enigma Machine, Fiji Mermaid, Apollo 13, Dymaxion House, Real Mona Lisa
episodes.overview: Did homemade heads help destroy the reputation of Alcatraz prison? How did the Enigma machine help to win World War II? And is the Walters Art Museum in Baltimore the actual home of the Mona Lisa?

episodes.name: Smilodon, Boeing B-29 Superfortress "Bockscar", Cardiff Giant, Train Disaster, Roswell UFO Crash, George Washington's Dentures
episodes.overview: Does a prehistoric "monster" provide clues to an Ice Age puzzle? Is an odd wooden figure the explanation for a 60-year-old mystery or the key to a government cover-up?

episodes.name: Patty Hearst, Mastodon, Humboldt Squid, Manhattan Project, San Francisco Earthquake, Ellis Island
episodes.overview: What does a vintage fire engine tell us about what really destroyed San Francisco after the 1906 earthquake? Does a 10,000-year-old mastodon skeleton reveal a shocking story of greed and murder inside one of our nation's most esteemed universities?

episodes.name: Harry Houdini Bust, Richard Byrd Expedition, Japanese Secret Weapon, "NOW" Protest Flag, Lizzie Borden, Adlai Stevenson's Briefcase
episodes.overview: Did the Japanese send weapons of mass destruction to the US mainland during World War II? Is a statue of illusionist Harry Houdini haunted? Does an old hatchet hold the key to one of the nation's most sensational unsolved murders?

episodes.name: Bonnie and Clyde Rifle, Iwo Jima Flag, Aerotrain, Anglerfish, Frederick Cook Diary, Joseph Kittinger Harness
episodes.overview: Bonnie and Clyde's Gun - The Iwo Jima Flag - The Aerotrain 1955 - The Deep Sea Anglar Fish - Who reach the North Pole First - 1960 100,000 feet parachute Trial.

episodes.name: Spruce Goose, T-Rex Skeleton, President McKinley Nightshirt, Art Heist, Johnstown Flood, Slinky
episodes.overview: Artifacts include the "Spruce Goose" aircraft, a T-Rex skeleton, President William McKinley's torn nightshirt, empty picture frames from an art heist, a watch from the Johnstown flood, and the invention of the Slinky.

episodes.name: Watergate, Radithor, German U-Boat 505, Lindbergh Ransom Note, Pat Garrett Gun, Greensboro Lunch Counter
episodes.overview: In the National Museum of Nuclear Science and History, there's a small vial that once contained a wildly popular drug called Radithor. Don Wildman discovers how this doctor-approved "cure-all" end up destroying countless lives.

episodes.name: Theodore Roosevelt, Eliot Ness, Spirit of America, The Titanic, Rosa Parks, Bigfoot
episodes.overview: Artifacts relating to the attempted assassination of Teddy Roosevelt, the Cleveland, OH torso murder serial killer, the capture of the land speed record by the U.S. from the British, the sinking of the Titanic, the civil rights movement, and Bigfoot.

episodes.name: Theremin, Tacoma Narrows Bridge, Silly Putty, Accidental Mummies, Mt. St. Helens, USS Cyclops
episodes.overview: The Theremin an electronic instrument in the Philly archives played into spy scandals, Silly Putty and the Tacoma Narrows Bridge are featured.

episodes.name: Empire State Building Plane Crash, Dillinger's Death Mask, Thomas Flyer, Edmund Fitzgerald, Frisbee, Fall of Saigon
episodes.overview: A New York City museum displays an artifact from an airplane which brought dread and destruction to the city; a metal staircase from the U.S. Embassy in Vietnam is on display at the Gerald Ford Museum in Grand Rapids, Michigan.

episodes.name: Skull and Bones Secret Society, AC Vs DC, DeLorean, USS Intrepid, Seattle Glue Pot, Wing Walkers,
episodes.overview: USS Intrepid, the Seattle glue pot and Wing-Walkers are featured.

episodes.name: Robert the Doll, Renault FT-17 Tank, Alan Shepard's Golf Club, Unabomber's Cabin, Jesse James' Holster, The Concorde
episodes.overview: The Concorde, Robert the Doll and the Unabomber's shed are featured.

episodes.name: Siamese Twins, Assassin Umbrella, Capone Haunted Cell
episodes.overview: Don examines the death case of Siamese Twins Cheng & Eng and unlocks their medical mystery. He studies an umbrella that played a role in a Cold War assassination. And, he visits a jail cell that holds a secret about Al Capone.

episodes.name: Annabelle Doll, Bridge Collapse, Whale Attack
episodes.overview: Don investigates the sinister secrets to a child's rag doll, studies a blueprint that holds the key to a deadly engineering disaster, and he examines a journal that inspired a fascinating work of American literature.

episodes.name: Prison Experiment, Butch Cassidy Manuscript
episodes.overview: Don investigates the sinister secrets to a child's rag doll, studies a blueprint that holds the key to a deadly engineering disaster, and he examines a journal that inspired a fascinating work of American literature.

episodes.name: French Connection, Shipwrecked Gold
episodes.overview: Don Wildman unlocks the secrets of an infamous drug syndicate and how it was brought down, when he reviews a dossier containing a series of photographs. He examines a gold ingot recovered from a long-lost sunken treasure.

episodes.name: Eastland Disaster, Smuttynose Murders
episodes.overview: Don Wildman uncovers the cause of the Eastland Disaster, one of the worst maritime disasters in American history, as he inspects a life jacket from the ill-fated steamship. And he examines an axe wielded by a killer in a bizarre double murder.

episodes.name: American Spy, Belle Gunness, Oarfish
episodes.overview: Don investigates the role an ordinary US Postal Service mailbox played in one of the most damaging spy cases of the Cold War. And he examines a monstrous preserved head that may prove the existence of a legendary sea beast.

episodes.name: Shrunken Heads, Broken Arrow
episodes.overview: Don examines what appears to be a miniature human head, brought back from the jungles of South America. And he surveys the dented casing of the hydrogen bomb that sat at the center of a horrifying nuclear accident.

episodes.name: LA Raid, Bioterror, Automaton
episodes.overview: Don unveils the real-life story behind an impressive work of art. He examines a simple tire cover connected to a bizarre religious cult. And he visits the robot that may have saved thousands of human lives in the worst nuclear disaster in American history.

episodes.name: Outlaw Shoes, Astrochimp
episodes.overview: Don inspects a strange pair of shoes that starred in one of the most bizarre and gruesome tales of the Wild West. And examines a miniature spacesuit - worn by a most unconventional space pioneer.

episodes.name: Anthrax, Marilyn Monroe, Hunley Submarine
episodes.overview: Don examines a simple cardboard box that's contents were once tied to a deadly outbreak that paralyzed the country with fear. He inspects a small pill bottle that may shed light on an icon's mysterious death. And he investigates a Civil War submarine.

episodes.name: Lotto Scam, Somali Pirates, Haunted Plane
episodes.overview: Don inspects a lottery ticket at the center of America's only known state lottery fixing scam. He surveys a giant orange lifeboat that survived a terrifying hijacking. And he investigates whether a damaged airplane part linked to bizarre ghost sightings.

episodes.name: Flying Car, Prison Riot, Dreamland Fire
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines an automobile designed to fly,inspects a circular saw and investigates a fire that decimated Coney Island's most extravagant amusement park.

episodes.name: Brinks Heist, Saddam's Spider Hole, Ringdocus
episodes.overview: Uncover the mysteries behind the largest armed robbery in US history, discover where Saddam Hussein was captured, and discover whether or not James Dean's car was really evil.

episodes.name: The Donner Party, the Shoe Bomber, FDR’s Cane
episodes.overview: Don Wildman travels the country inspecting a 100-year-old tissue sample that sent a doctor to the gallows, a collection of birds killed by a mysterious epidemic and the kettle used by a group of settlers to cook up a ghastly stew.

episodes.name: DB Cooper, Great Molasses Flood, Buddy Holly Curse
episodes.overview: Don learns about one of the nation's weirdest industrial disasters, inspects the wax likeness of an airplane hijacker and examines a pair of sunglasses once worn by a rock-and-roll pioneer.

episodes.name: Einstein's Brain, Morgan Affair, Brass Knuckles
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines sketches that depict otherworldly creatures said to have descended upon a Kentucky farm, a set of brass knuckles that protected a great president from a nefarious plot, and a building tied to a man’s strange disappearance.

episodes.name: Reagan's Limousine, Keely’s Motor
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines an armored limousine that played a central role in an assassination attempt, a giant book filled with vivid illustrations of mysterious birds, and the only known evidence of a revolutionary machine.

episodes.name: Roanoke, Edgar Allan Poe, Greenbrier
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a lock of hair linked to Edgar Allan Poe’s mysterious death, a sunken space capsule that provides clues to a NASA disaster, and a controversial medical manual that lies at the center of a rash of deaths in the Pacific Northwest.

episodes.name: Black Dahlia, French Angel, Sterling Hall Bombing
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a mysterious box that holds clues to Hollywood's most infamous unsolved murder, inspects the strange bust of a grotesque figure and investigates a notorious and deadly domestic terrorist attack.

episodes.name: Hitchcock's Birds, Hope Diamond, Phineas Gage
episodes.overview: Don Wildman inspects a jar of strange, preserved creatures that helped inspire one of the scariest horror films of all time, admires a legendary blue diamond and examines the shattered skull of a 19th century laborer.

episodes.name: Chowchilla Kidnapping, Texas City Disaster
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates how a school bus became involved in the largest kidnapping for ransom in US history, examines a deadly industrial accident, and seeks to unlock the mystery behind a handful of stones.

episodes.name: James Bond, La Belle Shipwreck, Polio Vaccine
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a vial tied to a daring medical experiment, a barrel that provides clues to a centuries-old shipwreck and a plaster molding that some say is proof of a mysterious bayou creature.

episodes.name: Roulette Computer, LA Shootout, Brooklyn Enigma
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a wearable computer used in a gaming scheme, a bizarre weapon of war that’s controlled by pigeons and a custom-made suit of armor that helped perpetuate the longest street battles in America.

episodes.name: Easter Island, The Red Ghost
episodes.overview: Don Wildman inspects the uniform worn by a highly unorthodox doctor, an antique bell linked to a monstrous creature and a monolith that may hold the key to the downfall of an ancient civilization.

episodes.name: Niagara Falls Daredevil, Accidental Nuclear Bomb, Railroad Heroine
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a lantern that guided a teenage girl on a quest to save lives, a homemade barrel used in a stunt, and a small metal fragment salvaged from a near-catastrophic disaster.

episodes.name: MGM Fire, UFO Car, Prophecy Sword
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a poker chip that bore witness to one of Las Vegas's greatest atrocities, a 1970s police cruiser with a bizarre past and a battered Civil War sword rumored to have special powers.

episodes.name: Prophet of Oak Ridge, Human Scalp, Mothman
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a trunk that may be evidence of a historic journey through Death Valley, a group of bricks from a Civil War prison break, and a human scalp that tells an astounding tale of frontier bravery.

episodes.name: Trunk of Horrors, Russian Roswell, Baby Incubators
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a trunk that holds the secrets of an unlikely killer, a collection of mysterious debris that may be proof of alien intelligence and a curious orb that tells the story of the rise and fall of a bizarre cult.

episodes.name: Leopold and Loeb, U2 Spy, Chewing Gum
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a revolutionary plow that sowed the seeds of a terrifying disaster, a primitive plane that challenges the history of flight and a deceptive coin that's designed to kill.

episodes.name: Buried Alive, Mauve, Crash at Crush
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines an antique doll tied to a woman’s confounding and tragic demise, an experiment gone awry that ignites the world of fashion and an audacious publicity stunt that ends in disaster.

episodes.name: St. Francis Dam, Philly the Dog, Suicide Table
episodes.overview: Don Wildman inspects a hunk of concrete tied to the rise and fall of a Los Angeles hero, a taxidermied dog that prowled the lines in World War I and an antique gaming table said to be imbued with a sinister curse.

episodes.name: Sheppton Mine Disaster, Shark Attack, Erie Collar Bomb
episodes.overview: Don Wildman inspects a makeshift harness that played a role in a dangerous mine rescue, a surfboard with evidence of a brutal, deadly oceanic predator, and a crude explosive device at the center of a sinister bank heist.

episodes.name: Cleveland’s Tumor, Man-Eating Lions, Meteorite
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a preserved mass of human tissue at the center of an American political scandal, a massive skull from a man-eating beast, and a meteorite that was once part of an improbable heist.

episodes.name: Santa Claus Heist, Long Island Heiress, Papago Park
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a pair of handcuffs that once bound the wrists of an unlikely criminal, a dress worn by a socialite at the center of a shocking crime, and a leather bag used in a legendary prison escape.

episodes.name: The Conqueror's Curse, Play-Doh, Poe Murder
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a dress worn by the star of an infamous Hollywood movie with a cursed past, a lump of gray clay that spawned one of America’s most iconic toys, and a faded brown document from a murder case that inspired a chilling literary classic.

episodes.name: Patience Worth, Space Monkey, Absinthe
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a set of books that contain a haunting tale told from beyond the grave, a primate involved in early space exploration, and a bottle of alcohol believed to compel drinkers to commit acts of violence.

episodes.name: Great Train Robbery, Phoenix Lights, Sea Serpent
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a wooden detonator used in an explosive railway robbery, a video camera that captured a bizarre, unexplained phenomenon and the massive skull of a legendary beast said to terrorize the seas.

episodes.name: Edison’s Electric Pen, Vanishing Carroll Deering, Lizard Man
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a failed invention that helped create a multi-billion dollar industry, the bell of a ship whose crew vanished at sea, and a footprint of a lizard-like creature that roams the swamps of South Carolina.

episodes.name: Boston Strangler, Operation Pastorius, Nellie Bly
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a weapon that belonged to a secret network of spies, a bag that belonged to a pioneering journalist, and a switchblade that belonged to a man some believed was Boston's most notorious killer.

episodes.name: Squeaky Fromme, Hodag, Typhoid Mary
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a weapon involved in a twisted plot to assassinate a US president, a beast that some believed terrorized people in Wisconsin, and a file that speaks of a notorious woman whose illness brought fear to New York City.

episodes.name: The Dance That Seduced a City, Vanishing Lake, Mysterious Death of Bugsy Siegel
episodes.overview: At the Chicago History Museum, a pair of ostrich-feather fans tells of a risque dancer who scandalized the Chicago's World Fair. At the Joseph Jefferson Mansion and Gardens on Lake Peigneur in Louisiana, an antique urn is one of few relics to survive a terrifying earth-shaking disaster. And at the Los Angeles Police Museum, twisted bullet fragments are all that remain of a notorious gangster's brutal slaying that remains shrouded in mystery.

episodes.name: Don Bolles' Quest for the Truth, Stanley's Miraculous Snake Oil
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a mangled car which tells of an intrepid journalist's quest for the truth, a vile of liquid containing what was believed to be a miracle cure and an iron safe which played a key role in a heist.

episodes.name: The Infamous Jersey Devil, Tank Rampage
episodes.overview: Don Wildman explores a plaster cast of hoof prints made by a mythic beast, a colossal war machine that once laid waste to an American city, and a presidential train car that remains shrouded in mystery.

episodes.name: Margery the Medium, Everest Ascent, The Pastor and the Choir Singer
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a strange wooden box used in a ritual, a weather beaten oxygen tank which tells of a daring ascent and the torn hat of a local pastor found at the scene of a crime.

episodes.name: Jack the Ripper in New York, Jim the Penman
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates an aged dossier which may be linked to one of the world’s most notorious killers, a century-old $20 bill which was once wielded by a brilliant and elusive criminal and an insect specimen which once wreaked havoc on America’s Heartland.

episodes.name: East River Blowout and The Day It Rained Meat
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a piece of industrial machinery from the early 1900s, a glass medical jar containing a strange substance and a tattered shirt that is one of the last vestiges of a aviation anomaly.

episodes.name: The Death William Wood, Hacker Spy, Skunk Ape
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a set of tattered and chipped ventriloquist dummies, a rudimentary electronic device and a plaster cast that may prove the existence of a creature thought only to exist in myths.

episodes.name: Prison Experiment, The Real Noah’s Ark
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a tattered briefcase belonging to an eccentric doctor who went to gruesome lengths in search of the fountain of youth, a massive chunk of stone which some believe is the fossilized remains of a biblical ship, and a reel-to-reel tape recorder used by one of the FBI's most prolific and notorious informants.

episodes.name: Asylum Poisoning, Naked Joe, The Mad Bomber
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a pair of timeworn, everyday dining implements that were at the center of an event that shocked and terrified a psychiatric ward, a charcoal portrait of a scantily clad man once embroiled in a notorious news expose and an aged dossier from the 1950s whose pages tell of one madman’s reign of terror.

episodes.name: Miracle Car, Glass Armonica, Yankee Spy
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a bright yellow car that once represented the promise of an automotive revolution, a mysterious musical instrument, and a strip of paper with a secret message that was passed across enemy lines.

episodes.name: Strangers on a Train, Madame Tussaud, WD-40
episodes.overview: At the Municipal Archives in New York City is a black and white negative containing an image of a deadly weapon used in a sinister plot of revenge. Just uptown in New York's Times Square sits the world famous Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum, where the likeness of one revolutionary woman is on display. And on the grounds of the San Diego Air & Space Museum in California is a large missile that led to the creation of a product that's found in nearly every household in America.

episodes.name: Psychic Horse, Strange Story of Rubber, Pulaski Axe
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a small memorandum book with notes from a strange encounter with an animal, a grey slab of material that revolutionized industry after an accidental discovery, and an innovative tool that changed heroes' jobs.

episodes.name: Funhouse Mummy, Playboy's Gold, Lawn Chair in the Sky
episodes.overview: Don Wildman inspects a pistol that's tied to one of the most bizarre series of events in the history of the Wild West, a Model B Wright Brothers Flyer that once belonged to a wealthy rogue, and an ordinary lawn chair that's been rigged to fly.

episodes.name: Outlaw Marshal, 76 Days Adrift, Diamond Hoax
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a deadly weapon from the Wild West that played a central role in a duplicitous plot, a device that sustained one man's unbelievable quest for survival on the high seas, and a set of 5 glimmering gemstones linked to a supposed land of riches that hypnotized some of the wealthiest men of their day.

episodes.name: Cinder Woman, Milgram Experiment, Gold Accumulator
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a set of binders that contain clues to an incendiary tale of a woman who met a bizarre and combustible fate, a box that was used in a shocking experiment and an oversized iron pot with metal rods.

episodes.name: Blonde Butcher, Charley Ross, Southern Sasquatch
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a handcrafted doll that is linked to one of the most memorable criminal cases of the 1930s, a glass bottle with a secret message, and a wire mesh screen that served as a window into a scary encounter.

episodes.name: Failed Assassination, Max Factor, Martian Monkey
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a pin that's connected to a devious plot to assassinate the president, a bizarre contraption that was designed by a pioneer in the glitzy realm of Hollywood and a strange being that some believed was evidence of a close encounter.

episodes.name: Civil War Prostitutes, Art Hoax, In Cold Blood
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a glass vial filled with a silvery salve that was used to wage a battle against a medical nightmare, a colorful canvas that hides an artful truth and a boot that was worn during a notorious murder.

episodes.name: Baseball Stalker, Peggy Shippen, Moon Hoax
episodes.overview: Don Wildman investigates a baseball bat linked to a case of fanatical mania, a set of letters that turned a infamous tale of deceit on its head and ornate wallpaper that reveals an astounding tale of astronomical intrigue.

episodes.name: Annie Oakley, Project Chariot, Prison Haunting
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a pistol linked to a legendary love story, a plant specimen that points to a toxic tale of abuse and a pair of cement shoes from a prison used to punish a convict.

episodes.name: Damascus Missile, Eye in the Sky, Soapy Smith
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines scraps of metal linked to a nuclear nightmare, a pair of binoculars wielded by a high-flying visionary and a life-sized effigy that immortalizes one of the West's most notorious cons.

episodes.name: Son of a Gun, Whale Rescue, Bottle Popping
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a bullet that is connected to a shocking tale of a seemingly immaculate conception, a machine used in an animal rescue mission and a deck of cards linked to a spine-tingling investigation.

episodes.name: Brassiere Brigade, Flight for Life, Connecticut Haunting
episodes.overview: Host Don Wildman examines a brassiere that gave salacious schemers an unexpected boost, a plane that soared to safety in a daring rescue mission and a religious icon allegedly scorched by the forces of evil.

episodes.name: Circling the Skies, Lady & the Panda, 12 Years a Slave
episodes.overview: Host Don Wildman examines a reel of film that depicts a high-flying stunt that changed aviation history, a panda discovered by an unlikely heroine and an aged document that tells the story of one man's unparalleled imprisonment.

episodes.name: Love Canal, Duquesne Spy Ring, Survival in the Colonies
episodes.overview: Host Don Wildman investigates a property deed tied to an epic fight for justice, a short-wave radio that wrought havoc in a high-stakes game of espionage, and a human skull that speaks to a harrowing saga of new-world survival.

episodes.name: Doyle & Houdini, the Poison Squad, the Great Imposter
episodes.overview: A feud between Arthur Conan Doyle and Harry Houdini is examined by the host, who later looks into the history of "Poison Squad" experiments and the beginnings of food and drug regulation. Also: the story of a jaw-dropping feat of trickery pulled off by a great impostor.

episodes.name: Tootsie Roll Miracle, Singing Convict, Operation Paperclip
episodes.overview: Host Don Wildman examines the Tootsie Roll candies that once saved the lives of a courageous band of soldiers, a guitar owned by a legendary musical jailbird, and a bicycle that helped launch humans into outer space.

episodes.name: Radioactive Boy Scout, Match of the Century, Four Corners Outbreak
episodes.overview: A badge that inspired a nuclear experiment; a chess set used in a match of Cold War wits; eerie animal specimens.

episodes.name: Nazi Art Hoax, Hunger Strike, Skull in the Ashes
episodes.overview: Don examines a damaged metal identification tag that played a role in a bizarre and heated crime, a painting by a man who pulled off one of the art world’s greatest deceptions, and a pin that represents a woman’s perilous push to advance equality.

episodes.name: Dare to Dream, Mail Missile, Child Warrior
episodes.overview: Don investigates a postal box that embarked on a gravity-defying journey, a traditional Viking vessel that sailed into the annals of modern history on an intrepid sea voyage, and a handmade talisman that weaves a tale of terror and courage on the American frontier.

episodes.name: Robber's Bride, The Night Disco Exploded, Escape By Sea
episodes.overview: Host Don Wildman examines an old Concord stagecoach that symbolizes a broken dream, a collection of melted vinyl records that sparked the decline of a cultural marvel, and a ship model that represents a bid for freedom.

episodes.name: Dramatic Defection, Wrong Way Flight, Cowboy's Revenge
episodes.overview: Host Don Wildman investigates a revolver that was responsible for global consequences, a bare-bones plane that speaks to a perilous, record-breaking adventure, and a set of mug shots that represents a link between a notorious crime ring and an unlikely hero.

episodes.name: Kiss that Saved a Million Lives, Heist of the Century, Lorenzo's Oil
episodes.overview: Host Don Wildman examines the beguiling cast of a woman who helped save thousands of lives after her death, a surfboard that speaks to one of the nation's most notorious capers, and a mysterious plant that offered unlikely hope to a family during their darkest hour.

episodes.name: Porcelain Twins, The Warden's Wife, Lost City of Atlantis
episodes.overview: Don investigates a china doll that speaks to a mystifying tale of deception, a bullet-marked sleigh that stood witness to the violent conclusion of a notorious love affair, and a set of common-looking stones that holds a possible clue to a lost civilization.

episodes.name: Dial M for Missing, $7 Renoir, Secret in the Attic
episodes.overview: Don examines a timeworn tome that may explain the perplexing disappearance of the world's greatest mystery writer, a Renoir painting believed to have been bought for just $7, and a police ledger that tells the tale of a secretive love affair that ended in murder.

episodes.name: Cellophane Start, Eruption Hoax, Parking Lot King
episodes.overview: Don examines a transparent roll of film that revolutionized the retail industry; a jacket that belonged to a prankster with an explosive sense of humor; and an unconventional excavation that puts a 500-year-old mystery to rest.

episodes.name: Mile-High Club, Attempted Assassinatio, Zip to Zap
episodes.overview: Don explores an aeronautical device with a notorious claim to fame; a cane that thwarted a would-be presidential assassin; and a souvenir T-shirt from an outlandish event that became an all-out rampage.

episodes.name: Opera Riot, Golfer Behind Enemy Lines, Great Mail Train Robbery
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a copy of a play that sparked riots, a monocular used by a soldier who made a daring and unusual escape from behind enemy lines, and the wrapper from a product so pungent that it caused an interstate postal feud.

episodes.name: Stolen Strad, Fall From Space, Czech Dream
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a concert program that marks one of the most infamous nights in the history of a prestigious music venue; a space capsule used by a heroic astronaut during a harrowing mission; and a DVD from an unusual film that blurred the lines between fact and fiction.

episodes.name: Birth of the Road Map; Attack of Killer Bees; Invention of Gas Mask
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines an iconic road sign that was part of a revolutionary plan to bring order to America's roads; a tiny bee specimen that unleashed madness; and a gas mask that was invented by a bold and pioneering man.

episodes.name: Erno Rubik's Cube; World's First Factor; The Amphicar
episodes.overview: Don examines a classic toy that became a pop-culture phenomenon; a delicate silk sample that symbolizes a stunning tale of international espionage; and a quirky car designed to travel on both land and water.

episodes.name: Invention of Pop Rocks; Pinball Wizard; London Smog
episodes.overview: Don examines one of America's most explosive candies; a pinball machine that represents a gutsy player who saved the game from obscurity; and a flare stick that guided Londoners through a unique time period.

episodes.name: Peanut Pusher, Hollywood Holdout, Lost Treasure
episodes.overview: Don examines a peanut that played a role in an unusual fad that took 1 man on a daring adventure; a standoff that pitted a man against some of Hollywood's most powerful people; and a set of gold relics that became the subject of an intense battle between 2 rival nations.

episodes.name: Peeping Butler, Beaver Bomb, Mother's Day Mother
episodes.overview: Don examines a trinket that symbolizes the stormy evolution of a beloved holiday; a novel contraption deployed to save a bevy of wild beavers in Idaho; and a scandalous machine that titillated Victorian England.

episodes.name: Cherry Sisters, President's Cow, Birth of a Riot
episodes.overview: Don Wildman examines a painted wooden sign that once advertised a vaudeville act so bad it was good; a famous cow's-milk can from the White House; and a program from one of the most polemic films of the 20th century.

episodes.name: Great Kipton Train Wreck, First Inoculation, Spanish Space Suit
episodes.overview: The story behind a science fiction novel that seemed so realistic it caused some to believe that the top-secret plans behind the Manhattan Project had been stolen. Also: a little girl's struggle for civil rights; and an invasion of giant destructive snails in South Florida.

episodes.name: Sci Fi A Bomb, Ford v. Ferrari, Colorado Stain
episodes.overview: Don examines a sleek American race car that took on a top Italian automaker; a pulp-fiction science magazine that threatened to expose an explosive World War II secret; and a set of teeth that was key in the biggest public health experiments of the 20th century.

episodes.name: Crossword Code, Ampelmann, Brushy Bill
episodes.overview: Host Don Wildman examines a puzzling crossword, a set of traffic signals that became a beloved symbol of East German culture, and a set of leg irons shackles that once restrained a legendary outlaw.

episodes.name: Cellini Heist, Real Romeo and Juliet, Link to the Skies
episodes.overview: Season 9 begins with host Don Wildman visiting a famous Renaissance sculpture that was once stolen in Vienna; and he learns about the inspiration behind a Shakespeare play while examining a rare book at Harvard. Also: the story of a strange flying device in Arizona.

episodes.name: Fallen Robins; Romeo Spies, All in for Poker
